title: SQL ServerPOWER()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerPOWER()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return 4 raised to the second power:
SELECT POWER(4, 2);

Definition and Usage
The POWER() function returns the value of a number raised to the power of another number.
Syntax
POWER(
a
,
b
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
a
Required. A number (the base)
b
Required. A number (the exponent)
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return 8 raised to the third power:
SELECT POWER(8, 3);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerPOWER()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerPOWER()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerPOWER()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
